headline: The Pipeline: Infranity eyes €3bn close, Allianz $500m Asia fund, Stonepeak German data platform
subheadline: Infranity eyes €3 billion close, Allianz plans $500 million Asia debt fund and Stonepeak plans German data center
summary: Generali-backed manager Infranity is on course to hit the target for its flagship infrastructure debt fund. The manager Enhanced Return Debt Fund was launched in September 2024 with a target of €3 billion.
author: Michael Harris

headline: BlackRock closes record $25bn for GIP Fund V
subheadline: First close since acquisition marks major fundraising milestone
summary: BlackRock has achieved a record $25 billion first close for Global Infrastructure Partners Fund V, the first major fundraising since completing its acquisition of GIP. The fund is targeting $30 billion with strong demand from existing LPs.
author: Sarah Chen

headline: Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners targets €12bn for Fund VI
subheadline: Danish manager launches largest renewable energy fund to date
summary: CIP has launched its sixth flagship fund targeting €12 billion, which would make it the largest dedicated renewable energy infrastructure fund ever raised. The fund will focus on offshore wind, green hydrogen, and energy storage.
author: Emma Wilson

headline: KKR reaches $6.4bn final close for Americas Fund II
subheadline: Fund exceeds target amid strong LP demand for infrastructure
summary: KKR has held a final close on its second Americas-focused infrastructure fund at $6.4 billion, exceeding its $5 billion target. The fund attracted commitments from major pension funds including CalPERS, OTPP, and several sovereign wealth funds.
author: James Rodriguez

headline: Brookfield launches $20bn flagship infrastructure fund
subheadline: Canadian giant returns to market with largest fund yet
summary: Brookfield Asset Management has launched its sixth flagship infrastructure fund targeting $20 billion, which would be its largest infrastructure vehicle to date. The fund has already secured $8 billion in early commitments.
author: David Park

headline: EQT closes Infrastructure VI at €7.2bn hard cap
subheadline: Swedish firm sees strong demand from European and Asian LPs
summary: EQT has closed its sixth infrastructure fund at its €7.2 billion hard cap, with strong support from European pension funds and Asian sovereign wealth funds. The fund will focus on digital infrastructure and energy transition assets.
author: Maria Santos

headline: Meridian raises $4.2bn for Clean Energy Fund III
subheadline: Renewable specialist exceeds target amid energy transition boom
summary: Meridian Infrastructure has closed its third clean energy fund at $4.2 billion, exceeding its $3.5 billion target. The fund will focus on solar, wind, and battery storage projects across Europe and the Americas.
author: Robert Chang

headline: Antin secures €10bn for mid-market Fund V
subheadline: French firm hits hard cap in competitive fundraising market
summary: Antin Infrastructure Partners has reached the €10 billion hard cap for its fifth mid-market infrastructure fund after just nine months in market. The fund attracted strong interest from North American and Asian investors.
author: Sophie Laurent

headline: Stonepeak targets $14bn for Infrastructure Fund V
subheadline: US firm launches largest fund as digital infrastructure booms
summary: Stonepeak has launched its fifth flagship fund targeting $14 billion, which would be nearly double the size of its previous fund. The vehicle will focus on digital infrastructure and energy transition investments.
author: Michael Thompson

headline: Apollo closes inaugural infrastructure fund at $4.5bn
subheadline: Alternative giant exceeds target for first dedicated vehicle
summary: Apollo Global Management has closed its first dedicated infrastructure fund at $4.5 billion, exceeding its $3 billion target. The fund received strong backing from insurance companies and sovereign wealth funds.
author: Jennifer Adams

headline: Brookfield to acquire Deutsche Telekom towers for €17bn
subheadline: Deal marks largest European digital infrastructure transaction of 2024
summary: Brookfield has agreed to acquire Deutsche Telekom tower portfolio for €17 billion in what would be the largest European digital infrastructure deal this year. The portfolio includes 40,000 towers across Germany and Austria.
author: Thomas Mueller

headline: KKR leads $8bn take-private of Spark Infrastructure
subheadline: Consortium deal values Australian utility at record multiple
summary: KKR is leading a consortium including PSP Investments and OTPP in an $8 billion take-private of Australian listed utility Spark Infrastructure, representing a 35% premium to the current share price.
author: Alexandra Wong

headline: Macquarie exits UK water utility in £3.8bn sale to Carlyle
subheadline: Sale delivers 2.3x multiple for Australian manager
summary: Macquarie Infrastructure has agreed to sell Southern Water to Carlyle for £3.8 billion, delivering a 2.3x return after a controversial five-year hold. The sale comes amid regulatory pressure on UK water utilities.
author: Richard Davies

headline: GIP and BlackRock partner on $15bn US renewables platform
subheadline: Joint venture to develop 20GW of solar and wind projects
summary: Global Infrastructure Partners and BlackRock have formed a $15 billion joint venture to develop renewable energy projects across the United States, targeting 20GW of solar and wind capacity by 2030.
author: Carlos Martinez

headline: EQT acquires EdgeConneX for $11bn from Partners Group
subheadline: Deal creates global digital infrastructure powerhouse
summary: EQT has agreed to acquire data center operator EdgeConneX from Partners Group for $11 billion, marking one of the largest digital infrastructure deals of the year. The company operates 50 data centers globally.
author: Lisa Chen

headline: CPP Investments buys 49% stake in Autostrade for €8bn
subheadline: Canadian pension takes major position in Italian toll roads
summary: CPP Investments has agreed to acquire a 49% stake in Italian toll road operator Autostrade from Atlantia for €8 billion, marking its largest European infrastructure investment to date.
author: Marco Rossi

headline: DigitalBridge completes $7bn acquisition of Zayo
subheadline: Deal strengthens position in fiber infrastructure
summary: DigitalBridge has completed its $7 billion acquisition of fiber network operator Zayo, significantly expanding its fiber infrastructure portfolio across North America and Europe.
author: Kevin Walsh

headline: Stonepeak sells Astound Broadband for $8.1bn to private consortium
subheadline: Exit delivers 2.8x return in three years
summary: Stonepeak has agreed to sell US cable operator Astound Broadband to a consortium led by Brookfield for $8.1 billion, generating a 2.8x return on its 2021 investment.
author: Patricia Lee

headline: I Squared Capital acquires Cube Highways for $2.5bn
subheadline: Deal marks largest roads platform transaction in India
summary: I Squared Capital has agreed to acquire Indian toll road operator Cube Highways for $2.5 billion from a consortium of sellers, marking the largest roads transaction in India this year.
author: Rajesh Patel

headline: Ardian and Saudi PIF launch $15bn energy transition JV
subheadline: Partnership targets green hydrogen and renewable projects
summary: Ardian has partnered with Saudi Arabia PIF to launch a $15 billion energy transition joint venture focused on green hydrogen production and large-scale renewable energy projects in the Middle East.
author: Ahmed Hassan

headline: CalPERS increases infrastructure target to 8% in major strategy shift
subheadline: Largest US pension fund to double infrastructure allocation
summary: CalPERS has approved increasing its infrastructure allocation target from 4% to 8%, potentially adding $20 billion in new commitments over the next five years. The move reflects growing institutional appetite for the asset class.
author: Nancy Williams

headline: OTPP launches direct infrastructure platform targeting $10bn
subheadline: Canadian pension to increase co-investments and direct deals
summary: Ontario Teachers has launched a dedicated direct infrastructure investment platform targeting $10 billion in investments over five years, reducing reliance on external fund managers.
author: Andrew Robertson

headline: GIC shifts infrastructure strategy toward energy transition
subheadline: Singapore sovereign wealth fund reallocates $20bn portfolio
summary: GIC is restructuring its infrastructure portfolio to increase exposure to energy transition assets, with plans to allocate $20 billion to renewable energy and clean technology over the next three years.
author: Michelle Tan

headline: European insurers increase infrastructure allocations amid Solvency II reform
subheadline: Regulatory changes open door for €50bn in new investments
summary: European insurance companies are increasing infrastructure allocations following Solvency II reforms, with Allianz, AXA, and Aviva planning combined investments of €50 billion over the next five years.
author: François Dubois

headline: APG and PGGM form €10bn Dutch infrastructure partnership
subheadline: Pension giants pool resources for domestic investments
summary: Dutch pension investors APG and PGGM have formed a €10 billion partnership to invest in domestic infrastructure, focusing on energy transition and social infrastructure projects in the Netherlands.
author: Hans van der Berg

headline: Sovereign wealth funds drive record $180bn infrastructure commitments
subheadline: ADIA, GIC, and QIA lead institutional investment surge
summary: Sovereign wealth funds committed a record $180 billion to infrastructure in 2024, led by major allocations from ADIA, GIC, and Qatar Investment Authority, according to new research.
author: Daniel Foster

headline: US endowments struggle with infrastructure portfolio construction
subheadline: Yale and Harvard reassess alternative investment strategies
summary: Leading US university endowments are reassessing their infrastructure strategies amid challenges in portfolio construction and concerns about high valuations in the asset class.
author: Peter Goldman

headline: Asian pension funds form $25bn infrastructure alliance
subheadline: Regional LPs collaborate on co-investment opportunities
summary: Major Asian pension funds including NPS Korea, EPF Malaysia, and Japan GPIF have formed a $25 billion alliance to pursue infrastructure co-investment opportunities across the region.
author: Yuki Nakamura

headline: BlackRock launches retail infrastructure fund targeting $5bn
subheadline: Asset manager opens private markets to wealthy individuals
summary: BlackRock has launched its first retail-focused infrastructure fund targeting $5 billion from high-net-worth individuals and family offices, democratizing access to the asset class.
author: Victoria Stone

headline: Climate risk drives LP portfolio rebalancing toward resilient assets
subheadline: Institutional investors prioritize climate-adapted infrastructure
summary: Institutional investors are rebalancing infrastructure portfolios toward climate-resilient assets, with major LPs divesting from coastal assets and increasing allocations to renewable energy.
author: Environmental Desk

headline: Digital infrastructure valuations reach new highs amid AI boom
subheadline: Data center multiples exceed 25x EBITDA on AI demand
summary: Data center valuations have reached unprecedented levels with multiples exceeding 25x EBITDA as artificial intelligence drives demand for computing infrastructure, raising concerns about sustainability.
author: Tech Desk

headline: Secondary market heats up with $45bn of LP portfolio sales
subheadline: Continuation funds drive record secondary transaction volumes
summary: The infrastructure secondaries market has seen record activity with $45 billion in LP portfolio sales and GP-led transactions in 2024, as investors seek liquidity in a challenging exit environment.
author: Markets Team

headline: European infrastructure debt market surpasses €100bn milestone
subheadline: Institutional demand drives growth in private debt solutions
summary: The European infrastructure debt market has surpassed €100 billion in annual issuance for the first time, driven by institutional demand for yield and capital requirements from developers.
author: Credit Desk

headline: Energy transition infrastructure needs $130 trillion by 2050
subheadline: IEA report highlights massive investment gap
summary: The International Energy Agency estimates $130 trillion in infrastructure investment is needed by 2050 to achieve net-zero targets, creating unprecedented opportunities for infrastructure investors.
author: Energy Desk

headline: US infrastructure bill drives $500bn in project opportunities
subheadline: Federal funding creates pipeline for private investment
summary: The US Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is creating $500 billion in project opportunities for private investors through public-private partnerships and co-investment structures.
author: Policy Desk

headline: Emerging markets infrastructure attracts record $85bn despite risks
subheadline: India, Brazil, and Indonesia lead developing market investments
summary: Infrastructure investment in emerging markets reached a record $85 billion in 2024, with India, Brazil, and Indonesia attracting the majority of capital despite currency and political risks.
author: EM Desk

headline: Private infrastructure outperforms public markets by 400bps
subheadline: Cambridge Associates study shows consistent outperformance
summary: Private infrastructure has outperformed public markets by 400 basis points annually over the past decade, according to new research from Cambridge Associates, validating institutional allocation strategies.
author: Performance Desk

headline: Green bonds transform infrastructure financing landscape
subheadline: Sustainable finance reaches $500bn annual issuance
summary: Green bond issuance for infrastructure projects has reached $500 billion annually, transforming how renewable energy and sustainable infrastructure projects access capital markets.
author: Sustainable Finance Desk

headline: Infrastructure funds hold record $350bn dry powder
subheadline: Deployment challenges persist amid competition for assets
summary: Infrastructure funds are sitting on a record $350 billion in undeployed capital, creating intense competition for assets and driving up valuations across all sectors.
author: Data Desk

headline: Social infrastructure emerges as new investment frontier
subheadline: Healthcare and education assets attract institutional capital
summary: Social infrastructure including healthcare facilities and education assets is emerging as a major investment theme, with institutional investors allocating $40 billion to the sector in 2024.
author: Social Infrastructure Desk

headline: Former GIP CEO Ogunlesi joins BlackRock as Vice Chairman
subheadline: Infrastructure veteran to lead integration and strategy
summary: Adebayo Ogunlesi, former CEO of Global Infrastructure Partners, has joined BlackRock as Vice Chairman following the firms merger, where he will oversee integration and infrastructure strategy.
author: People Desk

headline: Brookfield hires JPMorgan MD to lead European infrastructure
subheadline: Sarah Mitchell joins to expand continental presence
summary: Brookfield has hired Sarah Mitchell, former Managing Director at JPMorgan Infrastructure, to lead its European infrastructure business as the firm expands its continental presence.
author: People Desk

headline: CalPERS infrastructure team exodus continues with five departures
subheadline: Pension fund faces talent retention challenges
summary: CalPERS has lost five senior infrastructure professionals in the past six months, raising concerns about talent retention and investment continuity at the largest US pension fund.
author: People Desk

headline: EQT promotes Johanna Mikkola to global infrastructure head
subheadline: Internal promotion reflects firms commitment to continuity
summary: EQT has promoted Johanna Mikkola to global head of infrastructure, making her one of the few women leading a major infrastructure investment platform globally.
author: People Desk

headline: Macquarie raids KKR for Asia infrastructure head
subheadline: Competition for talent intensifies in Asian markets
summary: Macquarie has hired David Kim from KKR to lead its Asia Pacific infrastructure business, as competition for experienced professionals intensifies in the region.
author: People Desk

headline: Former UK Chancellor joins CIP as senior advisor
subheadline: Political connections strengthen as infrastructure becomes strategic
summary: Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners has appointed former UK Chancellor as senior advisor, highlighting the increasing importance of political connections in infrastructure investing.
author: People Desk

headline: Partners Group infrastructure co-heads resign amid strategy shift
subheadline: Leadership changes signal new direction for Swiss firm
summary: Partners Group two co-heads of infrastructure have resigned amid a strategic shift toward direct investments and operational value creation at the Swiss alternative asset manager.
author: People Desk

headline: Apollo builds infrastructure team with 15 new hires
subheadline: Alternative giant expands platform with senior appointments
summary: Apollo has hired 15 senior professionals for its infrastructure platform, including teams from Brookfield and KKR, as it builds out its infrastructure investment capabilities.
author: People Desk

headline: First female CEO appointed at major infrastructure consultant
subheadline: Cambridge Associates appoints Margaret Chen as CEO
summary: Cambridge Associates has appointed Margaret Chen as its first female CEO, marking a milestone for diversity in infrastructure investment advisory.
author: People Desk

headline: Industry veterans launch $2bn emerging markets infrastructure fund
subheadline: Former IFC and World Bank officials target developing markets
summary: A group of former IFC and World Bank infrastructure professionals have launched a $2 billion fund targeting sustainable infrastructure in emerging markets.
author: People Desk
